HButton

HButton is a control unit that provides the user a simple way to trigger an event and responds to mouse clicks and keystrokes by calling a proper action method on its target class.  A typical button is a rectangle with a label in its centre.  Button view or theme can be changed; the helmiTheme is used by default.

Summary
HButton
HButton is a control unit that provides the user a simple way to trigger an event and responds to mouse clicks and keystrokes by calling a proper action method on its target class.
Instance variables
constructor
draw
Draws the rectangle and the markup of this object on the screen.
refresh
Redraws only the label, not the whole markup.
HClickButton
Identical to HButton, except has the default action of incrementing its value by one whenever clicked.
constructor
click
Extend to implement your own js-side click actions.
HToggleButton
A button with a selected status which changes when the button gets clicked.
Static constants
Instance variables
constructor
setValue
Sets the selected status of the button.
refresh
Redraws only the label and button state, not the whole markup.

Instance variables

type’[HButton]’
labelThe string that is shown as the label of this object.

HControl HClickButton

constructor

constructor: function(_rect,
_parentClass,
_options)

Parameters

_rectAn HRect object that sets the position and dimensions of this control.
_parentClassThe parent view that this control is to be inserted in.
_optionsSee HControl.constructor and HComponentDefaults

draw

draw: function()

Draws the rectangle and the markup of this object on the screen.

See also

HView.draw

refresh

refresh: function()

Redraws only the label, not the whole markup.

See also

HView.refresh

HClickButton

Identical to HButton, except has the default action of incrementing its value by one whenever clicked.

Bind to a HValue to enable begin monitoring click actions at the server side.

Enables mouseup/down listening automatically, enables the click method to be extended.

See also

HToggleButton

A button with a selected status which changes when the button gets clicked.

Summary
Static constants
Instance variables
constructor
setValue
Sets the selected status of the button.
refresh
Redraws only the label and button state, not the whole markup.

Static constants

cssOnThe CSS class name of a selected item (“on”).
cssOffThe CSS class name of an unselected item (“off”).

Instance variables

type’[HToggleButton]’
valueA boolean, true when the button is on, false when it’s off.

Parameters

_rectAn HRect object that sets the position and dimensions of this control.

_labelThe string that is shown as the label of this object.

setValue

setValue: function(_flag)

Sets the selected status of the button.

Parameters

_flagTrue to set the status to selected, false to set to unselected.

Redraws only the label and button state, not the whole markup.

Redraws only the label and button state, not the whole markup.
Abstract foundation class for all active visual components that implement events and values.
Identical to HButton, except has the default action of incrementing its value by one whenever clicked.
A Rect object represents a rectangle.
constructor: function(_rect,
_parentClass,
_options)
The first two parameters are the same as with HView, but additionally sets the label and events.
Define default setting here.
draw: function()
Initializes the visual representation of the object, should call at least drawRect.
refresh: function()
This method should be extended in order to redraw only specific parts.
Data that needs to be syncronized between components or remote clients should be implemented as HValues.
Extend to implement your own js-side click actions.
